nodes.bodyText:
This is wierd. Does it work?
It doesn't modify the incoming config parameter, it reassigns it. Does this do anything?
The integration test proves that this works. I have no idea how it can work though.
@cuijulian Does the integration test fail if you uncomment this line?
Indeed, this looks quite peculiar...

@ge0ffrey The integration test still passes when I comment out that line. My thought process was to customize the JsonbConfig into the OptaPlannerJsonbConfig (which contains all the Score adapters) by reassigning it, but it seems to have no effect on the integration test. Alternatively, I could also manually customize the config using withAdapters(insert all OptaPlanner Adapters here) like it's suggested in the Quarkus docs, but I doubt that would have an effect either. @geoand Any thoughts on why this could be?
Separate question: when I build the module with -Pnative, the NativeImageTest fails with:
[ERROR]   OptaPlannerTestResourceIT>OptaPlannerTestResourceTest.solveWithSolverFactory:26 1 expectation failed.
Response body doesn't match expectation.
Expected: is "{\"entityList\":[{\"value\":\"v1\"},{\"value\":\"v2\"}],\"score\":{\"initScore\":0,\"solutionInitialized\":true,\"score\":0},\"valueList\":[\"v1\",\"v2\"]}"
  Actual: {"entityList":[{"value":"v1"},{"value":"v2"}],"score":{"score":0},"valueList":["v1","v2"]}

How come the non native integration test passes, but the native IT gives a differently formatted response?

@geoand Basically customizing the JsonbConfig config parameter with JsonbConfigCustomizer has no effect on the OptaPlannerTestResourceTest integration test.
As for the test issue, I'm going to do some more digging, I'll ping you if I have further questions. Thanks! :)

@geoand @ge0ffrey Fixed by modifying the config using withAdapters(), the integration test works with expected output, for both non native and native mode. Latest changes have been pushed and squashed.
Excellent!
Move this under the optaplanner-jackson module a few lines up - keep em together.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -99,6 +99,7 @@
         <module>cache</module>
         <module>qute</module>
         <module>bootstrap-config</module>
+        <module>optaplanner-jsonb</module>

nodes.bodyText: I would say let's add another 5 minutes here since we are adding a new module
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -406,6 +406,7 @@ jobs:
               logging-gelf
               bootstrap-config
               optaplanner-jackson
+              optaplanner-jsonb
           # kubernetes-client alone takes 30mn+
           - category: Misc3
             timeout: 50

nodes.bodyText:
This exposes the list of score implementations in quarkus, which is a maintenance problem in the long term. We regularly add score implementations upstream.
@cuijulian Can you open a jira to "add OptaPlannerJsonbConfig.getScoreAdaptorList() in optaplanner-persistence-jaxb" and add a comment here, something like "// TODO replace by  once released to avoid hardcoding the score implementations"
Then this PR is mergable. Once that jira is fixed and optaplanner is released, we send in a PR to quarkus to fix the TODO.
Doesn't need to be return a List. getScoreAdaptors() that returns a Class array is good too. Whatever works best.
Jira: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/PLANNER-1922. Comment added, changes pushed in latest commit.

@cuijulian (very soft suggestion - as we need to wait for optaplanner 7.35 to go out anyway): would you mind adding a hint in this TODO when it will be possible to fix it? For example: "when upgrading to optaplanner 7.36" (that TODO fix didn't make 7.35 which is being released). Before it was merged, I'd use the Jira url.
Also it's unclear which class has "getScoreAdaptorList()", making it hard for others your yourself in 6 months to figure out this TODO easily.
Good point. I may as well also bump the optaplanner-bom version to 7.35 in this PR before it get merged.
Shouldn't this be a dependency on quarkus-jsonb-deployment instead?
nodes.diffHunk:

+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"

+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
+            <artifactId>quarkus-jsonb-spi</artifactId>

nodes.bodyText: The quarkus-jsonb-spi dependency is needed in the deployment module according to the docs. But I am missing the quarkus-jsonb-deployment dep here, fixing in next commit.

nodes.bodyText:
Good point. Sorry, didn't check :/ Fixing in next push.
Perhaps the docs should instead say to add quarkus-jsonb-deployment rather than quarkus-jsonb-spi? Same goes for quarkus-jackson-deployment. I can make a PR for that.

nodes.bodyText:
Well, not really. You want to use the SPI if your dependency to Jackson/JSON-B is optional (which is often the case).
Here you really want a hard dependency so you don't have to use the SPI: you need the whole extension.

nodes.bodyText: If you have the optaplanner dependency here, you need the deployment counterpart in the deployment pom.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,56 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
+         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 https://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+    <parent>
+        <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
+        <artifactId>quarkus-optaplanner-jsonb-parent</artifactId>
+        <version>999-SNAPSHOT</version>
+    </parent>
+    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+    <artifactId>quarkus-optaplanner-jsonb</artifactId>
+    <name>Quarkus - OptaPlanner JSON-B - Runtime</name>
+    <description>Activate JSON-B bindings for OptaPlanner's Score classes</description>
+
+    <dependencies>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
+            <artifactId>quarkus-core</artifactId>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
+            <artifactId>quarkus-jsonb</artifactId>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
+            <artifactId>quarkus-optaplanner</artifactId>
